help-file.title: DRUID
help-file.content:
Druids are powerful priestly types that concentrate their discipline toward the betterment of nature and world preservation. They generally worship deities of the forest and of nature and will dispatch anyone attempting to desecrate or destroy a forest. Although their spell-like powers are primarily defensive in nature, they do command some very potent offensive magic once they attain the higher circles.
Druids have shunned the pantheon of gods and allied themselves with the natural world instead. They must 'commune' with their surroundings to derive the natural essence that is necessary for their spells. This essence is most abundant in the untamed wilds.
The Druid class does not pray for spells like other "priests", instead, their spell slots refill automatically as long as they are not fighting, casting, unconscious, etc. It is unnecessary to designate a specific array of spells to memorize (see below). To offset this, the rate of spell recovery depends on the availability of natural essence in the Druid's surroundings. This essence is readily available in forests, but becomes more scarce on other types of terrain, especially indoors. Furthermore, the essence is automatically channeled into the lowest circle that is not completely full before it is channeled into higher circles, so it is impossible to prioritize what spells to regain first. Overall, Druids have slower, more constant spell recovery.
Allowable races: Human, Grey Elf, Half-Elf, Centaur
Innate abilities: Shapechange, Charm Animal, Plane Shift
Equipment Usage: Druids fall under the Priest classification of item restriction. This means they are generally restricted to the use of non-edged weapons. Some exceptions are made depending on which deity the druid worships. They can wear almost all types of armor, and are only mildly restricted in usage of certain miscellaneous magical items.
